member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.GetParent(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Tries its best to return the specified element's parent. It will try to find, in this order, the VisualParent, LogicalParent, LogicalTemplatedParent. It only works for Visual, FrameworkElement or FrameworkContentElement.
member.param: The element to which to return the parent. It will only work if element is a Visual, a FrameworkElement or a FrameworkContentElement.
member.remarks: If the logical parent is not found (Parent), we check the TemplatedParent (see FrameworkElement.Parent documentation). But, we never actually witnessed this situation.

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: This will search for a parent of the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The node where the search begins. This element is not checked.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will search for a parent of the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The node where the search begins.
Should the specified startingObject be checked first.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean,System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: This will search for a parent of the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The node where the search begins.
Should the specified startingObject be checked first.
Provide a callback to check additional properties of the found elements. Can be left Null if no additional criteria are needed.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.
member.example: Button button = TreeHelper.FindParent<Button>( this, foundChild => foundChild.Focusable );

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindChild``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: This will search for a child of the specified type. The search is performed hierarchically, breadth first (as opposed to depth first).
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The root of the tree to search for. This element itself is not checked.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.
